chargeHist.descr: Possession With Intent to Deliver Heroin(>3-10g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor N Lapham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second or Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.
  • Carrying a Concealed Knife [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.231.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Uncharged DA case 21EC1547 is dismissed and read in.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.

Obtain GED or HSED. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor N Lapham

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 21CF820, 21CM54, 21CM101, 22CF687 are called at 4:04 PM)  Defendant Taylor N Lapham in court, in custody with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard. District Attorney Peter Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense is ready to proceed and requests we resolve 22CF687 today as well. Clerk adds case to the court's calendar. No additions or corrections to the revocation packet. State recites the joint sentence recommendation. 
22CF687- Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1- Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g) as Repeater and Second or Subsequent Offense and Count 3- Carrying a Concealed Knife. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including uncharged DA case 21EC1547. 
Court orders in 22CF687 Count 1- 4 years of Initial Confinement with 4 days credit and 5 years of Extended Supervision.
 Court orders in 22CF687 Count 3- 9 months jail with 4 days credit concurrent to Count 1. 
Court orders in 21CF820- 4 years of Initial Confinement with 132 days credit and 5 years of Extended Supervision. 
Court orders in 21CM101- 9 months jail with 136 days credit. 
Court orders in 21CM54 Counts 1 and 3- 9 months jail with 133 days credit. 
Court finds the Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision: No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Obtain GED or HSED; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; in 22CF687 only- Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. 
Court orders in 21CF820, 21CM54, 21CM101- Any remaining financial obligations are reduced to a civil judgment.

9:33 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Taylor N Lapham in court, in custody with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Branch 3 for scheduling Arraignment.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

Case called at 11:16 AM.
Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Taylor N Lapham appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson.
State requests $5,000 Cash Bond (Probation absconding, delivery of heroin, history of failing to appear).Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 7/11/22 at 1:45 PM.
RTN: 8/2/22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
